ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:0.5_0: 35. The training rule on making a heap
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate their almsfood picking from a heap. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat almsfood picking from a heap,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.4_0: he should not eat almsfood picking from a heap;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood picking from a heap, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.11_0: if only a little food remains and he eats it after collecting it in one place and then picking from it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.15_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on fifth, is finished.
